title: Strictly's Neil Jones and Kevin Clifton defend Alex Scott's score
text:
Strictly’s Neil Jones joins Kevin Clifton in defending Alex Scott’s score (Picture: BBC)

Strictly’s Neil Jones and Kevin Clifton have thrown their support behind Alex Scott’s scores.

The former footballer’s partner had to drop out of Saturday’s performance after injuring himself, leaving Kevin to step in and learn the whole routine last minute.

Taking to Twitter, the official competition’s account shared a video of their dance and applauded the duo for their efforts.

Alongside the short clip, they wrote: ‘When your dance partner’s injured, who you gonna call @AlexScott ? @keviclifton ! That’s the #Strictly spirit you two.’

And Neil was quick to reply as he jumped to his celeb dancing buddy’s side in defense.

The 37-year-old wrote: ‘I know the whole routine and I can say 100% she was on time all the way through.’

Neil had to drop out after injuring himself (Picture: WireImage)

And it seems Kevin was in agreement, as he retweeted his pal’s message, adding: ‘Yep. I went wrong a couple of times cos didn’t quite know the routine.

‘But @AlexScott was perfect all the way through. She carried me through the whole thing with class!’

It seems fans were not bothered by the mistakes however, as they applauded the tag team in the comments.

‘Alex and Kevin, you were amazing, for you to do that in such a short time, I take my hat off to you @keviclifton and @AlexScott you were a fabulous teacher and I just loved you and your enthusiasm and energy,’ one wrote while another added: ‘You did amazing!!’

Someone else said: ‘Honestly admire you for stepping in at such late notice, you did a great job with such little time and should be proud!’

Cladia Winkleman informed viewers that Neil had dropped out of the performance after suffering from an injury earlier on in the day.

She said: ‘You may have also noticed Neil is missing this evening. Now unfortunately he also suffered an injury earlier today and is unable to dance tonight.

‘But the brilliant Kevin will be stepping in to perform with Alex later in the show.’

Ahead of the dance to the Ghostbusters theme tune, Kevin added: ‘Well, I’ve got to get in the final one way or another, haven’t I? But this is not me, this is about Alex and she is so amazing.

‘She’s been guiding me through the routine and that’s real test for her so I will do my best for you and for Neil.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Sunday night on BBC One.
